info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 26 at 9:53AM MDT until further notice by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Billings MT has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Montana... Little Bighorn River Near Hardin affecting Big Horn County. .Recent heavy rainfall may keep water levels near flood stage over the next few days. In addition, high flows on the Bighorn River may back up the Little Bighorn River at the confluence causing flooding in the Hardin vicinity. Whether flooding develops will depend on additional rainfall upstream over the next few days along with any additional increases in flow on the Bighorn River this week. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Little Bighorn River near Hardin. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM MDT Monday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Little Bighorn River Hardin 8.0 7.1 Mon 9 am 5.7 5.0 4.7 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. A Flood Watch means that flooding is possible. Now is the time to prepare for action in the event flooding occurs. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning.Tuesday morning by 1000 AM MDT.
